sectionTitle: Timeline of Jain History (Sections K to M)
pageSubtitle: Jain Academic Bowl Manual - Sections K to M

events.title: 3500-3000 BC
events.description: Recorded history of Jainism and period of the Indus Valley Civilization, where relics suggest Jain prevalence. (Ref: L.1.2, L.1.3, p381)

events.title: 3000 BC
events.description: Approximate time yoga was practiced in ancient India, based on archaeological evidence. (Ref: K.6.3.4, p363)

events.title: 10th Century BC
events.description: King Nebuchadnezzar is said to have visited a temple of Neminäth. (Ref: L.1.4.1, p382)

events.title: 642-413 BC
events.description: Shishunäg dynasty, whose kings Bimbisär and Ajätashatru supported Jainism. (Ref: L.1.7.1, p388)

events.title: 599 BC
events.description: Approximate birth year of Bhagawän Mahävir. (Ref: L.1.4.3, p383)

events.title: 567-487 BC
events.description: Probable life period of Buddha, a contemporary of Bhagawän Mahävir. (Ref: L.1.4.3, p383)

events.title: 527 BC
events.description: Nirväna of Bhagawän Mahävir. The fifth Ärä began three years and eight months after this date. (Ref: L.1.3, L.1.4.3, p382, 383)

events.title: 64 years after Nirväna
events.description: Jambu Swämi, the last omniscient of this half cycle, attained salvation. (Ref: L.1.4.3, p383)

events.title: 413-322 BC
events.description: Nanda dynasty; King Nanda brought an idol of Rishabhadev from Kalinga. (Ref: L.1.7.1, p388)

events.title: ~367 BC
events.description: Pätliputra Recension (First Vächanä) was held. (Ref: L.2.3, p393)

events.title: 160 years after Nirväna
events.description: Time until which Ägam Sutras were passed on orally in their entirety. (Ref: L.2.1, p391)

events.title: 345 years after Nirväna
events.description: Dharmasen, the last of the Das-purvi according to Digambars, died. (Ref: L.2.2.3, p393)

events.title: 322-298 BC
events.description: Reign of Emperor Chandragupta Maurya, who abdicated his throne and migrated to the South. (Ref: L.1.5, p384)

events.title: by 300 BC
events.description: Jain migrations from eastern India to western India likely took place. (Ref: L.1.7.3, p389)

events.title: 215 years after Nirväna
events.description: Death of Sthulibhadra. (Ref: L.2.3.1, p394)

events.title: 3rd Century BC
events.description: The process of the split between Shvetämbar and Digambar started; Ächärya Bhadrabähu predicted a famine. (Ref: L.1.5, p384)

events.title: 3rd Century BC
events.description: Ächärya Bhadrabähu composed the Kalpa Sutra. (Ref: L.2.11.2, p408)

events.title: 297 BC
events.description: Death of Guru Bhadrabähu. His disciple Chandragupta died a few years later. (Ref: L.1.5, p384)

events.title: 273-236 BC
events.description: Reign of Emperor Ashok, who embraced Jainism before his conversion to Buddhism. (Ref: L.1.7.1, p388)

events.title: 2nd Century BC - 2nd Century AD
events.description: Period when the 12th Anga Ägam (Drashtiväd) is believed to have been lost. (Ref: L.2.1, p391)

events.title: 2nd Century BC
events.description: Kalinga was center of empire ruled by Kharavela, great patron of Jain faith. (Ref: L.1.7.1, p388)

events.title: Mathurä Region
events.description: Middle of 2nd Century BC: Branch of Jains firmly established in North India. (Ref: L.1.7.4, p389)

events.title: 161 BC
events.description: King Kharavela brought back an idol of Agra-Jina (Rishabhadev) from Magadh. (Ref: L.1.3, p381)

events.title: 150 BC
events.description: Fall of the Mauryan dynasty, leading to a large-scale migration of Jains. (Ref: L.2.3.2, p394)

events.title: 57 BC
events.description: Beginning of the Vikram Samvat era. (Ref: L.1.4.3, p383)

events.title: 1st Century AD
events.description: Umäsväti's Tattvärtha-sutra written before final Shvetämbar/Digambar division. (Ref: L.1.5.1, p385)

events.title: Early 2nd Century AD
events.description: Possible time period for Ächärya Umäsväti based on inscriptions. (Ref: L.2.11.4, p409)

events.title: 160 AD
events.description: Period when Shatakhandägam was written. (Ref: M.1.1, p423)

events.title: 584 years after Nirväna
events.description: Death of Ächärya Vajra, ending Das-purvi serial according to Shvetämbars. (Ref: L.2.2.3, p393)

events.title: 600 years after Nirväna
events.description: Approximate time the Jain religion split into Digambar and Shvetämbar. (Ref: L.1.5, p384)

events.title: 100 AD
events.description: Niyamsär, Panchästikäy, Pravachansär, Samaysär written by Kundkund. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.4, L.2.11.3, p406, 408)

events.title: 100 to 1000 AD
events.description: Period when great Ächäryas wrote scriptures that Digambars follow today. (Ref: L.2.4.2, L.2.9, p395, 404)

events.title: 200 AD
events.description: Tattvärtha-sutra written by Umäsväti. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.4, p406)

events.title: 200-400 AD
events.description: Probable composition period for Tattvärtha Sutra. (Ref: L.2.11.4, p409)

events.title: 3rd Century AD
events.description: Powerful dynasties in Maharashtra like Sätavähana, Chälukya, Rästrakut, etc., extended patronage. (Ref: L.1.7.3, p389)

events.title: 3rd to 6th Century AD
events.description: Period of the Kadamba rulers of Banaväsi, some of whom were devout Jains. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: around 300 AD
events.description: Memorized Shvetämbar Ägam-sutras were written down. (Ref: L.2.1, p391)

events.title: 830 years after Nirväna
events.description: Monks assembled in Mathurä for the second recension. (approx 303 A.D.) (Ref: L.2.3.2, p394)

events.title: 303 AD
events.description: The second Vächanä (Recension) writing of Ägam took place in Mathurä. (Ref: L.1.7.4, L.2.3, p389, 393)

events.title: 350 to 999 AD
events.description: Ganga Rulers of Talakada in Karnataka patronized the Jain religion. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: 980 years after Nirväna
events.description: Jain canon was first written down at the council of Vallabhi. (approx 453 A.D.) (Ref: L.1.7.3, L.2.3.3, p389, 395)

events.title: 453 AD
events.description: Third Vächanä at Vallabhi where available scriptures were documented. (Ref: L.2.3, L.2.11.2, p393, 408)

events.title: up to 500 AD
events.description: Mathurä was a stronghold of Jains for nearly 1000 years. (Ref: L.1.7.4, p389)

events.title: 500 to 757 AD
events.description: Chälukya rulers of Badami in Karnataka were pro-Jain. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: 5th Century
events.description: Jain monks added more rites to stop outflow to Hinduism. (Ref: L.1.6, p387)

events.title: 5th Century BC
events.description: Time when Rishabhadev was worshipped and his idol was highly valued. (Ref: L.1.3, p381)

events.title: 5th - 16th Century
events.description: Period of noteworthy Jain logicians from Siddhasen to Yashovijayaji. (Ref: K.1.1, p314)

events.title: 5th or 6th Century
events.description: Sarvärtha Siddhi of Pujyapäd-swämi was written. (Ref: M.1.1, p423)

events.title: 7th Century AD
events.description: Time of Jain Ächärya Shri Haribhadra-suri, who sanctioned Patanjali's Ashtanga Yoga. (Ref: K.6.3.4, p363)

events.title: 600 AD
events.description: Mulächär, Trivarnächär by Vattaura; Ratna-karanda Shrävakächär, Äpta-mimämsä by Samantabhadra. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.2, p405)

events.title: 650 AD
events.description: Padma Purän written by Ravisen. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.1, p405)

events.title: 7th or 8th Century
events.description: Period to which available Churni commentaries belong. (Ref: L.2.8, p402)

events.title: 700 AD
events.description: Commentary on Tattvärtha-sutra by Pujyapäd. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.4, p406)

events.title: 757 V.S / 857 V.S
events.description: Assigned period for Ächärya Haribhadra-suri, who wrote Sanskrit commentaries. (Ref: L.2.8, p402)

events.title: 750 AD
events.description: Commentaries on Tattvärtha-sutra and Äpta-mimämsä by Akalank. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.4, p406)

events.title: 757 to 973 AD
events.description: Rästrakut of Malakhed in Karnataka were pro-Jain. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: 770-850 AD
events.description: Life period of Digambar Ächärya Jinsen, author of Mahä-Purän. (Ref: M.1.1, p423)

events.title: 780 AD
events.description: Ächärya Virsen and Jinsen wrote commentaries Dhavalä-tikä, Mahä-dhavalä-tikä, and Jay-dhavalä-tikä. (Ref: L.2.9.1.1, p404)

events.title: 783 AD
events.description: Harivamsa Purän and Ädi Purän written by Jinsen. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.1, p405)

events.title: 8th Century
events.description: Ächärya Haribhadra-suri wrote Shad-darshan Samuchchaya and Yoga Drashti Samuchchaya. (Ref: M.1.1, p423)

events.title: 800 AD
events.description: Commentaries on Tattvärtha-sutra and Äpta-mimämsä by Vidyanand. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.4, p406)

events.title: 800 AD
events.description: A Jain temple recently discovered in Gujarat was built. (Ref: L.1.7.4, p389)

events.title: 879 AD
events.description: Uttar Purän written by Gunabhadra. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.1, p405)

events.title: 9th Century AD
events.description: Earliest date commentaries on Uttarädhyayan-sutra were written. (Ref: L.2.11.1, p407)

events.title: 10th - 12th Century AD
events.description: Western Chälukya rulers of Kalyän showed a liberal attitude to Jainism. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: 10th Century
events.description: Shri Amritachandra Ächärya wrote a critique on Samaysär called Ätmäkhyäti. (Ref: L.2.11.3, p408)

events.title: 10th Century
events.description: Shilänk-suri wrote Sanskrit commentaries. (Ref: L.2.8, p402)

events.title: 1000 AD
events.description: Gommatsär written by Nemichandra Siddhänt. (Ref: L.2.9.1.3.3, p405)

events.title: 1006 to 1345 AD
events.description: Hoyasala rulers of Halebid in Karnataka supported Jainism. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: 11th Century AD
events.description: Life period of commentator Abhaydev, who wrote on nine Anga. (Ref: L.2.8, p402)

events.title: 1088-1173 AD
events.description: Life period of Hemchandra-ächärya, author of Trishashti Shaläkä Purush. (Ref: M.1.1, p423)

events.title: 11th Century
events.description: Vardhamänsuri made efforts to curtail the excesses of Yatis. (Ref: M.1.1, p423)

events.title: ~1100 AD
events.description: Jainism gained ascendancy under Chalukya kings Siddharäj and Kumärpäl. (Ref: L.1.7.3, p389)

events.title: ~1150 AD
events.description: Jindatta-suri (Dada Gurudev) founded the Kharatar Gachchha. (Ref: M.1.1, p423)

events.title: 1156 to 1183 AD
events.description: Kalachuri rulers of Kalyän were Jains, and Jainism was the state religion. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: 12th - 13th Century
events.description: Difficulties in protecting temples/literature; Chaityaväsi and Bhattärak roles created. (Ref: L.1.6, p387)

events.title: 12th Century
events.description: Decline of Jainism in South India due to Srivaisnavism rise. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: After 12th Century
events.description: Significant impact of Vedic and Muslim religions on Jainism. (Ref: L.1.6, p387)

events.title: 12th Century
events.description: Maladhäri Hemchandra was a Sanskrit commentator and scholar. (Ref: L.2.8, p402)

events.title: 13th Century AD
events.description: Jainism received patronage through ministers Vastupäl and Tejpäl. (Ref: L.1.7.3, p389)

events.title: 14th Century AD
events.description: Jainism played important role in overall history of south India. (Ref: L.1.7.2, p388)

events.title: 1448-1515 AD
events.description: Life period of Tarana-Swämi, founder of the Täranapantha. (Ref: L.1.5.3.3, p387)

events.title: Around 1450 AD
events.description: Lonkäshah of Ahmedabad began to dispute temple rituals. (Ref: L.1.5.2, p385)

events.title: 1474 AD
events.description: Sthänakaväsi tradition came into existence. (Ref: L.1.5.2, p385)

events.title: 16th Century
events.description: Hirvijay-suri impressed Mughal emperor Akbar. (Ref: M.1.1, p423)

events.title: Late 16th Century
events.description: Digambars experienced a significant revival. (Ref: L.1.5.3, p386)

events.title: 1583 AD
events.description: Emperor Akbar prohibited animal slaughter during Paryushan. (Ref: L.1.7.4, p389)

events.title: 1610 AD
events.description: Jain deputation secured ruling prohibiting animal slaughter from Emperor Jahangir. (Ref: L.1.7.4, p389)

events.title: 1627 AD
events.description: Teräpantha (Digambar) arose in North India as revolt against Bhattäraks. (Ref: L.1.5.3.2, p387)

events.title: 1760 AD
events.description: Swämi Bhikshu Mahäräj founded the Teräpantha tradition. (Ref: L.1.5.2.3, p386)

events.title: 18th Century
events.description: Dharmasinha Muni wrote his own interpretations of commentaries. (Ref: L.2.8, p402)

events.title: 18th Century
events.description: The Teräpanthi tradition separated from Sthänakaväsi. (Ref: L.1.5.2.3, p386)

events.title: 19th Century
events.description: Shrimad believed decline was due to excessive sectarianism. (Ref: M.2.9, p428)

events.title: 19th - 20th Century
events.description: Jain scholarship became popular in foreign languages. (Ref: L.1.8, p390)

events.title: 1864-1901 AD
events.description: Life and mission period of Virchand R. Gandhi. (Ref: M.3.1, p430)

events.title: 1867-1901 AD
events.description: Life period of Shrimad Räjchandra. (Ref: M.2.1, p424)

events.title: Nov 9, 1867
events.description: Birth of Shrimad Räjchandra. (Ref: M.2.2, p424)
Virchand Gandhi graduated B.A. from University of Bombay. (Ref: M.3.1, p430)
English translation of Jain Sutras by Hermann Jacobi. (Ref: L.1.8, p390)
Virchand Gandhi became honorary secretary of Jain Association of India at 21. (Ref: M.3.1, p430)
Essay 'Radvä Kutväni Hänikärak Chäl' by V.R. Gandhi published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)

events.title: 1888 AD
events.description: Shrimad Räjchandra married Zabakben and became gemstone partner. (Ref: M.2.3, p425)

events.title: 1889-1980 AD
events.description: Life period of Shri Känji Swämi. (Ref: M.1.2, p423)

events.title: 1890 AD
events.description: Death of Joothäbhai, close disciple of Shrimad. (Ref: M.2.7.4, p427)
Virchand Gandhi shut down pig slaughterhouse at Sametshikhar. (Ref: M.3.1, p430)

events.title: 1891 AD
events.description: Shrimad Räjchandra attained Samyag Darshan at age 23. (Ref: M.2.6, p426)
World Parliament of Religions; Virchand Gandhi was representative. (Ref: L.1.8, p390)

events.title: Sep 11, 1893
events.description: Opening day of Chicago Parliament of Religions. (Ref: M.3.1, p430)
'Unknown Life of Jesus Christ' by V.R. Gandhi published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
First English translation of Uttarädhyayan-sutra published. (Ref: L.2.11.1, p407)
Virchand Gandhi collected famine relief while in the U.S. (Ref: M.3.1, p431)
Shrimad Räjchandra composed Ätmasiddhi-shästra. (Ref: M.2.5, p425)

events.title: 1899 AD
events.description: Shrimad Räjchandra retired from business at age 31. (Ref: M.2.3, p425)

events.title: 20th Century
events.description: Shri Känji-swämi gave detailed analysis on Samaysär. (Ref: L.2.11.3, p408)
'Savirya Dhyän' by V.R. Gandhi published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)

events.title: 1905 AD
events.description: Death of Ambälälbhai, disciple of Shrimad. (Ref: M.2.7.3, p427)
'Jaina Philosophy' by V.R. Gandhi published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
'Yoga Philosophy' by V.R. Gandhi published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
'Karma Philosophy' by V.R. Gandhi published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
Mrs. Sinclair Stevenson published 'The Heart of Jainism'. (Ref: L.1.8, p390)
'Concentration – 12 Lectures on Meditation' published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
Helmuth Von Glasenapp wrote 'Jainism An Indian Religion of Salvation'. (Ref: L.1.8, p390)
Movement by Känji Swämi stressing inward thought started. (Ref: M.1.2, p423)
Ächärya Tulsi, at 21, took over Teräpanthi sect. (Ref: L.1.5.2.3, p386)
Ächärya Tulsi initiated Anuvrat movement. (Ref: L.1.5.2.3, p386)
'Herbert Warren’s Jainism' published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
'Selected speeches of V. R. Gandhi' published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
'The Systems of Indian Philosophy' by V.R. Gandhi published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
Saman-Suttam created during 2500th Nirväna anniversary of Mahävir. (Ref: L.2.11.5, p411)
Ächärya Tulsi introduced new order of Shraman/Shramani. (Ref: L.1.5.2.3, p386)

events.title: Nov 28, 1980
events.description: Death of Känji Swämi in Mumbai. (Ref: M.1.2, p423)
'Religion and Philosophy of Jains' by V.R. Gandhi published. (Ref: M.3.2, p432)
Ächärya Mahäshramanji took over Teräpanthi leadership. (Ref: L.1.5.2.3, p386)
Year of Government of India's Census recording Jain population. (Ref: L.1.8, p390)

items.content:
• 3rd / 4th Ärä: Eras in which one has to be born to attain everlasting (Kshäyik) Samyaktva. (Ref: K.4.2.4, p341)
  • 5th Ärä: Current period; max 7th Gunasthän reachable from Bharat/Airävat. (Ref: K.4.2.7, p342)

• 250 years: Time by which Bhagawän Pärshvanäth preceded Bhagawän Mahävir. (Ref: L.1.4.2, p382)
  • 12 years: Duration of famine in Magadh leading to splitting changes. (Ref: L.1.5, p384)
  • 150 years: Time between second and third recensions. (Ref: L.2.3.3, p395)

questions.question: When was the recorded history of Jainism and the period of the Indus Valley Civilization?
Around what time was yoga practiced in ancient India, based on archaeological evidence?
Which king is said to have visited a temple of Neminäth in the tenth century B.C.?
What was the approximate birth year of Bhagawän Mahävir?
When did Bhagawän Mahävir attain Nirväna?
Who was the last omniscient of this half cycle, attaining salvation 64 years after Mahävir's Nirväna?
When was the Pätliputra Recension (First Vächanä) held?
Who reigned from 322-298 B.C. and later abdicated his throne, migrating to the South?
When did the process of the split between Shvetämbar and Digambar start?
Who composed the Kalpa Sutra in the 3rd century B.C.?
When did King Kharavela bring back an idol of Agra-Jina (Rishabhadev) from Magadh?
When did the Vikram Samvat era begin?
When was Umäsväti's Tattvärtha-sutra written, according to one source?
Around what time was the Jain religion split into Digambar and Shvetämbar sects?
Who wrote works like Niyamsär and Samaysär around 100 AD?
When was Tattvärtha-sutra written by Umäsväti, according to another source?
When did the second Vächanä (Recension) of Ägam take place in Mathurä?
When was the Jain canon first written down at the council of Vallabhi?
For how long was Mathurä a stronghold of Jains?
Who wrote Sarvärtha Siddhi in the 5th or 6th century?
Who wrote Padma Purän around 650 AD?
What is the life period of Digambar Ächärya Jinsen, author of Mahä-Purän?
Who wrote commentaries Dhavalä-tikä, Mahä-dhavalä-tikä, and Jay-dhavalä-tikä around 780 AD?
When did Shrimad Räjchandra compose 'Ätmasiddhi-shästra'?
When did Virchand R. Gandhi represent Jains at the World Parliament of Religions?
When was the book Saman-Suttam created?
questions.answer: 1974 (during the 2500th Nirväna anniversary of Bhagawän Mahävir)

questions.question: When did Ächärya Tulsi initiate the Anuvrat movement?
What is the life period of Shrimad Räjchandra?
When did Shrimad Räjchandra attain Samyag Darshan, according to belief?
